result.execSummary:
The defendant James H Branam Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for James H Branam Jr.
Current: PO Box 282, Kettle Moraine Correctional Institute, Plymouth, WI 53073 United States  (Effective: 08-26-2015)
Prior: Forest County Jail, 100 S Park Avenue, Crandon, WI 54520
Notice to DA sent to Judge Kussel for signature

Attorney Robert A Kennedy in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 11:24 a.m. State here on motion filed by Kennedy. Kennedy states motion in regards to his client is not someone that is in need of rehabilitation, no factual basis in regards to sexual offender, asking the court to restate what has alreay been done, asking that court could indicate that his defendant should not be classified as sexual offender. State - makes statement in regards to sexual offender findings at sentencing, DOC  has final say regarding sex offender programming within an institution. The State does not object to the defendant's request that the Court indicate that a sex offender finding is clearly not appropriate. Pamela Overbay sworn in 11:33 a.m. Kennedy directs. Witness excused 11:38 p.m. State asks to clarify what Kennedy is asking for in motion. Kennedy informs Court what he is asking for as Court is not clear of his intent. Previous counsel Burns makes statement. State has no objections to Kennedy's request but feels the request is out of the State and Court's authority and it would be up to DOC. Kussel - record speaks for itself in regards to Judge's intent at sentencing, does not believe there is anything more this Court can do in regards to the sex offender registration, may be an administrative challenge thru DOC to remedy Kennedy's request. Kennedy responds. Court makes no further ruling or resolution. Adjourned at 11:47 AM.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James H Branam in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.   Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 9:30 am. Resolved. Plead to count 4 as alleged. Count 1, 2 & 3 amend to misdemeanors disorderly conduct and obstructing. State has complied with victim witness - no impact statement and no request for restitution. Burns Count 1, 2 & 3 maximum sentence and run concurrent to felony count - Count 4 - 5 years in WPS with 2 in and 3 on extended supervision asks for earned release. Court reads new charges/penalties. Defendant pleads guility to count 1, 2 & 3 as amended and guility to count 4 as alleged. State makes statement regarding why not asking for sex offender registry and was part of the plea negotations and opposes that being ordered. Burns comments on being a registered sex offender. Court goes thru plea questionnaire and finds is entering plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently waives right to JT, factual basis, acceepts plea and finds guility to count 4 and count 1 947.01 as DC, count 2 947.01 as DC and count 3 946.41 as obstructing. Defendant is waiving his right to PSI. State objects to earned release for stated reasons. Burns makes statement asks for earned release for stated reasons. Branam withholds statements. Court will not order sex registry.  Proceed to sentencing. 
Count 1 - 90 days jail, Count 2 - 90 days jail, Count 3 - 9 months jail all concurrent to each other and count 4. 
Count 4 - 5 years prison 2 in 3 extended supervison - conditions follow rules of probation - concurrent with count 1, 2 & 3 - earned release granted. 
189 days credit - costs on all counts - $250 felony surcharge and sample if not provided. 
Firearms, voting rights given. Appeal rights given.
amended
verbally accepted by court on 7/8/14
Jury trial on August 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 31, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Called at 11:16 AM. James Branam Jr appears in person and in custody with attorney Brittney LaFond appearing specially and Attorney Mary Burns also available in the Courtroom. State appears by Charles Simono.  State will be filing an amended Information adding a Felony Bail Jumping count. LaFond will waive reading of Information and understands it will be amended adding the additional bail jumping count, will plead NG to all counts, requesting a speedy trial demand. Court accepts verbal request for speedy trial demand, sets for #1 JT on 8/19/14 at 8:30 AM with a PTC on 7/31/14 at 9:30 AM.
Arraignment on July 8, 2014 at 11:15 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: of judge
Arraignment on March 19, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Called at 3:38 PM. James Branam Jr appears in person and in custody with attorney Mary Burns. State appears by Charles Simono. State calls Officer Darrel Wilson. Wilson sworn in at 3:39 PM. Direct exam by State. Record reflects proper identification of the defendant. Cross exam by Burns at 3:49 PM. Burns makes a blanket objection to all of the hearsay during direct exam. Court so notes. Burns continues cross exam. State objects - beyond scope of PH - sustains (3:51 PM). State objects - sustained (3:52 PM). Wilson excused at 3:53 PM. State - no argument. Burns - asks for court not to find probable cause. Court finds probable cause, binds over for trial, continues bond, set for ARGN on 3/19/14 at 10:30 AM.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on March 12, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Called at 10:51 AM. James Branam Jr appears via video from FOSO and his counsel Mary Burns appears in person. State appears by Jodie Bednar-Clemens. Burns provided with complaint in court. Court has previously read the charges and penalties. Burns states she is appearing specially today, defendant is currenlty on a P&P hold, waives time limits and requets PH. Court continues bond, set for PH on 3/12/14 at 3:00 PM.
Adjourned initial appearance on February 19, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Called at 1:49 PM. James Branam Jr appears via video from FOSO and without counsel. State appears by Charles Simono. State - believes defendant has copy of the complaint and it will be modified to add more charges. Branam has received criminal complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Branam understands charges, wants an attorney, needs court appointed attorney, informed to contact SPD, clerk will send court appointed information to the defendant. Court continues bond, set for AIA on 2/19/14 at 9:00 AM.
No consumption of alcohol. No contact with M.E.D. (DOB: 2/19/01). No contact with any female under the age of 18.
$50,000 cash set
